Posts.Content:
Hi Everybody,
I want to share with you an unusual personal experience.
Few months ago I was diagnosed with cancer. My doctor told me that I have pancreatic carcinoma that cannot be operated and that I need to start chemotherapy ASAP! I was stressed, are there no other options? I was afraid of the side effects of this treatment.
I started chemo. Few weeks later I felt worse. The doctors told me that my tumor was resistant to the chemo. They changed the drug, but in the meantime I was also looking for an alternative treatment… and I found it (I think…). It’s called Gene-Eden and it is based on a scientific research of chronic viruses that cause cancers. I said to myself, this supplement is not going to kill you, but the cancer is – give it a try. I called them up and they offered me a nice discount and ask me to let them know about
 any progress or side effects I have. After using it for few days, I had no bad side effects, but I was still in pain and felt no improvement. I called them again and we decided to double the dose. Five weeks later I felt much better, pain was gone, the tumor got smaller and I even had more white blood cells.
I am done now with my chemo treatment, and I still take Gene-Eden. I am so happy now. I am feeling very good about
 my decision to go ahead and use a supplement. I know others that suffer from cancer, so I wanted to share my story with you.
Although I had no breast cancer, I thought it might be interesting to know. Maybe this is what you need… give it a try!
all the best,
Gizi
Posts.Title: this is what I did to feel better after chemo

Posts.Content:
Hi Jane,
I am very happy and I thank you for your support... it is very important for me.
I love the idea that supplements are important to support treatments. our conventional medicine has not yet solve all of our problems... and maybe never will. it just takes too long...
I don't dare to stop taking my supplement
Gizi
Posts.Title: this is what I did to feel better after chemo

Posts.Content:
Thanks for the note BEV,
I will be happy to post some interesting developments (I hope there won't be too many).
I appreciate your concern,
Hags... to you too and good luck,
Gizi
